Reviews.Title: “Fab budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindi3
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel if you're on a budget. Rooms are basic but good enough. The location could not be better and breakfast is lovely. The only problem is that the stars are a bit lethal so don't go if you have mobility issues. Staff very warm and friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kelliemark
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just 5 minutes walk from the Covent Garden tube station. Found it easy with the directions give. We arrived about 12 midday and they allowed us to check-in 2 hours early so that was fantastic! although the room was on the top floor which was not fantastic! Must have climbed at least 50+ steps which is not ideal when you have luggage! The room itself was just basic, double bed, t.v shower etc tea making facilities but no tea/coffee/milk etc! the toilet was shared with others on the same floor - not a problem though. the breakfast was lovely. it was a hot buffet breakfast....bacon, sausage, variety of eggs, beans, tomatoes. toast and tea/coffee. so fill up on breakfast as much as you want! staff were nice and polite, free wi-fi. the location was fantastic because of the trips and restaurants we had booked! 5 minutes walk to the Lyceum and 10 minutes to the Strand - we booked a meal at The Savoy which was amazing. around 15 minutes walk to The Embankment (London Eye etc) so there was no need to use the underground as everything was within walking distance! would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: P_Stibbons
Reviews.Content: Hotel accommodation in London is expensive, but here you do get value for money considering. Obviously, there's not much beyond bed, TV and bathroom/shower, but it's all serviceable and the internet's free. Friendly and helpful staff and a really great location make this a good place for a short trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but friendly”
Reviews.Author: LiamCaine
Reviews.Content: just got back from London stayed at the 7 dials hotel in covent garden, the location is very good, we booked a double room ensuite, but it was not what we got, we were allocated a very small single room on the 5th floor with a 3/4 bed which was pushed up to the wall not ideal when u want to use the toilet i had to climb over my girlfriend to get out of the bed, the shower room was not very wide probably suit someone about 6st and very thin, we were also given a key to use the toilet down the hallway cos our room didnt have a loo, its not easy climbing the stairs, the breakfast was good, we paid £210 for 2 nights, we wudnt stop there again, the hotel is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: claireship
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel a few minutes walk away from the centre of Covent Garden. The room was quite small but had an ensuite shower and was very clean. There is a 24 hour reception and the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, usual full English plus cereals, toast and juice. Perfect as a tourist base or for somewhere to stay after a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Never mind the size - Location is all.”
Reviews.Author: Galavanti
Reviews.Content: This sweet, funny, TINY, quiet, hotel was clean, warm, friendly and comfortable. The location was second to none - rubbing shoulders with the very expensive Covent Garden Boutique Hotel across the road, which costs 3 times as much. The room was very small but who comes to Covent Garden and stays in their room? This was a great base for the sights, theatre and restaurants. I WILL DEFINATELY STAY AGAIN. Breakfast, which was full english with no frills, was included - great value for money. You could always pop into the Covent Garden Hotel on the way back to bed and have a bottle of wine if you are looking for up market ambiance. But who needs ambiance when you are asleep in a comfy warm bed!

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: LazyB64
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes up for the size of the rooms and the need for a lick of paint. The towels and bed linen were spotless but the 'bathroom' , which I suspect started life as a cupboard, had a hole in the door and no lock. It was minute and minimal. The staff are charming anf helpful and the breakfast is more than adequate. Stairs are a bit of a problem if you are getting on or have walking difficulties as the are very spiral and have no handrails. Overall we enjoyed our stay but wouldn't choose to stay for more than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Mould heaven”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to culture some penicillin! Mould was all over the walls underneath the bubbling of the wallpaper! This hotel is amazingly situated right in the middle of west end, however definitely not worth the 105GBP a night that we paid. We paid less for hostels and got better livings while travelling over 5 weeks in the UK!!! After finding out we were on the 4th floor, we were offered no help in getting our 30kg luggage up the narrow winding stairs! We were advised that they would prefer if we paid a day before our check out! Breakfast on a weekday was at 7.00am-9.30am, after walking down to the breakfast part of the hotel (basement) were were greeted with a line of people waiting for tables. Once receiving a table at 9:15, we had to advise the waitresses that there was no food left. The condiments provided are also all out of date. On one morning, advising one of the reception staff of the mould, we were told that they were attending to other rooms first before the one we were in. After 3 nights in the incredibly small room were we definitely ready to leave. Expensive, not what the pictures show on the website and stay if only needing something close to West End.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended. If you are aware and chose wisely.”
Reviews.Author: Mario_MZG
Reviews.Content: This a very useful reference hotel... if you really know what you will get. The hotel does not have any bells and whistles... it does not have any "turkeys" either. And all reviews must have in consideration the cost/benefit ratio. Location could not be better, right in the heart of Covent Garden, where all the action goes: theatres, pubs, restaurants and all the Soho life nearby. Plenty of underground stations around. Piccadilly Line direct to Heathrow Airport. Price does not get any better in any hotel 5 kilometers around. We paid 140 UK pounds per night on a triple room (more about that later) including breakfast. Staff is friendly, kind and willing to help, where necessary. Room care is addequate, bed grooming, full towel change and WC cleaning everyday. Now, what you should be aware about: Hotel is in a narrow building with 4 floors (we stayed in 3rd), there is no elevator (lift) and the stairs are narrow. Bringing in the suitcases may be a chore (I was offered help but declined), bringing them out is the same, but this is work to be done only once on arrival and once on departure. However, if you have mobility issues, be aware. Rooms have the bare essentials, however clean, cozy and quite new. But rooms are not spacious. When me & my wife reserved, there was only a triple room available but we reserved anyway, because the price & location were right. This triple room (#11 on 3rd floor) was exactly right for us, with a nice double bed plus a single bed where we could spread our things and open our suitcases. If we were on a double (or if we were 3) the suitcases should have to stay open in the floor. The WC was ok, small but addequate, good shower, lavatory and toilet. Be aware that economy hotels in London have usually *very bad* WC's (or they have shower but no toilet, or no WC at all). What else ? A clothes keeper big enough with lots of hangers & 4 drawers, two bedside drawers, small TV, hairdrier & mirror, coffee/tea kettle with cumplimentary coffee, tea & cookies every day. The hotel stays in a very quiet street but cornering with a busy avenue. Londoners are noisy (and frequently unpolite and rude), you may be bothered with noises at night, like buses and lorries passing by, some sirens and even obnoxious people honking at 4am !! Not to mention the "night birds" speaking or singing loud as they pass by. Bring in your earplugs. And your eye covers (curtains are thin and don't block daylight). We were lucky, neighbour hosts were quiet (this is always a question of luck). Big central heating, switched on when necessary (temperature was very comfortable). No AC, big fan in ceiling (maybe useful in summer, but London is never hot anyway). Breakfast is the typical English breakfast, not our preference but quite addequate and substancial anyway. All in all, and with the correct pondering of pro's and con's, this is a very interesting choice for an hotel, that we may easily use again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your peril”
Reviews.Author: BristolSparky
Reviews.Content: Dark dreary rooms. I beg to differ with your reviewer our room wasn't partcularly clean.I feel the whole hotel could do with a revamp and some tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: DontSlipUp
Reviews.Content: It's the location which makes this hotel special, and saves time and travelling expense if you are 'doing' the West End, Theatreland, Soho etc. We only used one short bus ride during our 3 day stay. Room 4 at the back was roomy enough with a double and single bed. The ensuite was a bit tight to get into due to its wedge shape but once inside the shower itself was big. The room was clean with laminate floor, and being at the back was quiet at night even with the window open. We were on the first floor, the stairs were narrow winder style. The dining area in the basement was clean and the staff efficient and friendly. Breakfast was an acceptable cooked breakfast, but only Corn Flakes for cereal eaters, no fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Clodia94
Reviews.Content: 3 day trip with a friend. We had a twin room on the 2nd floor at the front; wonderful display of Christmas lights outside, but they were turned off at 11.30 pm so we could sleep. The room was basic; 2 beds, small tables, wardrobe with plenty of hangers, but what else did we need? There was a small ensuite shower room with toilet and washbasin, spotlessly clean as was the room. The beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of room for our clothes etc. Beds were made/room cleaned daily. The location of this hotel is fantastic; 5-10 minutes' walk from all the theatres, from Covent Garden Plaza, from a huge choice of restaurants, cafes and bars ranging from cheap to expensive, and some good real ale pubs. 10 minutes walk to the river too, and only 15 minutes taxi ride from Kings Cross though getting back there was a different story! The staff at the hotel are wonderful: friendly, welcoming and nothing too much trouble. There is always someone on duty to release the door lock at the front door, so you feel secure, and they happily look after your bags on the final day; we felt it was safe to leave them near Reception because there is always someone there and they won't release the door except to guests. The breakfast was a bit basic, like the rooms, but edible, and included in the price, but if you want a lie-in there are several nice cafes almost next door for coffee/croissants etc as breakfast is quite early at 7-9 a.m. There is no lift and the stairs are narrow, but staff happily help with luggage so no worries there. Rooms are extremely good value for this part of central London: we paid Â£250 for 2 of us for 2 nights. And I've had poorer service in 5 star hotels! It can be a little noisy at night (this is the centre of London after all) but we had no trouble sleeping and after midnight it quietened down a lot. The staff were so obliging and made us feel very welcome, not at all impersonal like some hotels. I'd happily go there again.

Reviews.Title: “location is perfect...the only perfect thing!”
Reviews.Author: fraba
Reviews.Content: My third time in London. The hotel is poor, cleanliness is an optional, the only positive aspect is the location, close to the subway station "Covent Garden". If you do not find anything else and if you have just to spend no more than two days in London, try the experience to bring up on a forth floor your bags with no lift and a room witch was supposed to be "ensuite" with an outside toilet...amazing! Bring your own amenities as shampoo, conditioner, etc. The close Punjab indian restaurant to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OVER PRICED”
Reviews.Author: ABC1945
Reviews.Content: the first room we were offered was very small with the bed against the corner, and on the third floor, without a lift. the stairs are hard to negotiate. The manager was very helpful and changed the room to a larger one, which was slightly dated but comfortable, shower good, but no shower gel or shampoo which you would expect for Â£115 per night, breakfast no choice of cereal, fry up good, toast and tea lacking. OVERALL FOR Â£115 VERY DISSAPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and basic.”
Reviews.Author: artymedsec
Reviews.Content: Just what we wanted, yes noisy but in the central of London what does one expect? Nothing a pair of earplugs doesn't solve!!! Decor a bit dated. Staff were v v helpful, letting us check in early as my friend needed to lie down after a v early start. Advised us to change travel plans on day of leaving as times of tube on a Sun were different. Booked cab for us. Room spacious, we had a triple for the 2 of us. If you want cheap, clean and cheerful, v v central this is for you. If you are looking for extra comfort or luxury, this isn't for you.,

Reviews.Title: “Great Little hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplepirahna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seven Dials when we came over to London to see a concert at the O2, nice little hotel, lots of stairs, and room pretty small but very clean, manager and staff very helpful and friendly, good breakfast, we are both vegies but managed to have a decent brekki, slightly expensive for the size of the rooms but thats probably because of the location, great location right in Covent Garden, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very nice”
Reviews.Author: dondecon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Seven Dials as the location was near to where we were going, i.e. Covent Garden. Found the room basic but comfortable, we did not have breakfast as we had no time, The staff were very helpful and we were able to leave our luggage there all day. Would definately stop again and for central London it was Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for location, bad choice for comfort”
Reviews.Author: LeaAthens
Reviews.Content: We had an experience of two different rooms here. The first room we stayed in was exremely small. There was a small souble bed fitted within three walls and with two suitcases in the room there was no room at all, we had to climb over etg. The closet was also very small and you coundlt open it because the front of it was the only place where your suitcase could be sitting. It was located at the back with a small window, the room was dark, and the view was not appealing. The second room was entirely different, much more space, with a double and a single bed, a rpoper closet and room to move. It was located on the front side of the hotel and had large widows, bringing lots of light. We were really pleased with this room. The staff were very helpful. The breakfast is served in a small underground room and there is much to be desired. Some guests had nowhere to sit when they came down. The hotel is all about location and price. It is very near the metro station and the price is very good for such a location in London. I would only go back if i had the front room again and if I skipped breakfast alltogether.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the annex”
Reviews.Author: kim_mulholland
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£138 to spend one night in the "annex" of the Seven Dials Hotel. This is possibly the worst value for a hotel I have ever encountered in many years of international travel. The entrance off the street felt like the entrance to a dingy brothel. The room looked like it had been put together by an amateur DIY man. When I opened the wardrobe it fell on me. The bathroom was so small it was hard to turn around. There was no refrigerator. The TV was tiny and very old. For Â£50 I would have accepted all this - but not for Â£138!

Reviews.Title: “clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: GAKdiva
Reviews.Content: A centrally situated hotel- ideal for theatreland and covent garden. The room I had had an extremely comfy bed but the room itself was very small and the "ensuite" arrangement was very interestin to say the least- ie IN your room not a seperate ensuit. Having said that the staff were very pleasant and breakfast was ok. The whole hotel was clean. this was not luxury but I suppose for central london and for Â£85.00 that is what you get....

Reviews.Title: “Not for everybody - but good for some”
Reviews.Author: Smfarnsworth
Reviews.Content: I try and sleep in different hotels when staying in London so that I can see different areas. This time I fancied Covent Gardens and the theatre district and stumbled across the Seven Dials Hotel - which at Â£95.00 inc breakfast in London - is very cheap!!! Personally - I thought the hotel was fine but I can imagine other people complaining about a whole host of things. The bathrooms are tiny (showers not baths) - but the shower worked fine, the water was warm and plentiful and the towels were fine - it was functional with no frills - soaps, shampoos etc. The beds are big and comfortable, clean and neat - but clearly not expensive - again, functional no frills. The hotel itself - the "lobby" is tiny and there is no lift/elevator. I was on the top floor (4th) and the stairs are very steep and narrow. I wouldn't have liked to get a young family or big/heavy suitcase up there and it absolutely isn't accessible for disabled travellers or the elderly (unless super fit). I had a sound sleep - which for noisy London is good. The breakfast is adequate - again no frills. I would stay again but wouldn't recommend it to everybody - some people like to be pampered - but there again they won't get pampered in London for Â£95.00

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quaint.”
Reviews.Author: 2637mdk
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel, right in the heart of West End, in a lovely street. Quite noisy at night because it's an old building, but the room was clean and nice. Kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joford
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Covent Garden and don't want to pay an arm and a leg this is a great place to stay. However, the rooms and bathroom are very small. The staircase leading up to the rooms is very narrow so you wouldn't want to have a large case as there's not a lot of space to haul it up the stairs and there's no lift. The carpet on the narrow staircase was a little loose in places and even without a suitcase was a little tricky. The people are lovely and the rooms are spotless. It was quite basic but there were tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was in the cellar and was small and packed. It was a British breakfast of beans, sausage, bacon, egg, toast. Not as bad as I thought it was going to be having read the reviews. It was hot in the room and we needed the windows open but that meant it was quite noisy at night. If you were staying when its cooler this wouldn't be such a problem as the windows had good sound proofing. For a short stay in the centre of London this was perfect for me although I wouldn't stay here if I had large luggage or needed a bit more space.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great alright, but will not stay there again! bed bugs alert!”
Reviews.Author: candyrock
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of previous positive reviews of how clean it was and how good the location is. Well the location is just superb, I'd have to admit. Convent Garden, lots of nice shops, restaurants and cafes. Close to all the theatres and nightlife spots. I did not have any high expectations of this hotel, because the price is quite cheap and from the photos I've seen online I just did not have any sort of expecation, except that it has to be clean! But the hotel was not that clean at all. Once I step foot in the small lobby with the dark green carpet, there was this weird smell!!! You will get use to it after a while, but it was not pleasant. The bed sheets pillow case didn't feel clean.. I ended up getting bites from bed bugs!!!!! My bed was next to the heater.. and very close to the wall and the wall had dust and yellow stains on it.. also the heater had stains. It was very gross having to have to sleep so close to the stains! There are no elevators, so you have to carry your luggage up and down those ridiculously narrow stairs. This had been said before so it was expected and I had no probelm with that. BUT the thing I had a problem with is that when I was pulling my luggage down the stairs getting ready to check out. The lady at the front desk did not help me with my luggage (which was expected) AND asked me to be more quiet with my luggage in a rude way! It was 11pm in the morning, and the cleaners were vaccuming so noise was not an issue. Maybe she was afraid I would break their fragile stairs. But the luggage was heavy ofcourse there are gonna be some noise. If she was so concern I think she should come help me instead of just sitting there complaining after the luggage had already been taken down. What's the point? I'm already checking out and that is my only piece of luggage, and I am never coming back again. The washroom was so small, you can only stand and turn, don't even have enough room to change your clothes in there... unless you change in the shower area. The washroom door lock was broken, the door was dented, looked like someone punched a hole in it previously. The toilet paper were crap.. no tissue available.. even if you have to wipe your face or mouth, you'd just have to use their toilet paper. So I had to run down to the corner store to get some boxed tissue. Just not a good experiece, the whole thing looks haunted.

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: cazscho
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations about this property after reading some reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. Great value for the area. The seven dials area has a great atmosphere. The room was basic but clean and comfortable. The windows were very well sound proofed. The breakfast was a bit of a letdown but there are lots of places nearby to get breakfast. I will defiantly be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alli_P
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews I wasn't sure what to expect, but what I found was perfect for a couple of nights stay in London. We were in room 10, which was street facing and had both a single and double bed in it. So plenty big enough for the two of us. As others have said there are no lifts, so climbing the 50 odd steps up to the room, with suitcases was interesting! It was also incredibly hot in London, but there was a fan in the room (which when you had the bathroom door opened whacked into it, LOL), which did the job. Breakfast was ok, usual fry up with choice of cereals. The best thing about this hotel though is location, a stones throw away from Covent Garden and Theatre land - perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem? Only the location.”
Reviews.Author: live4ska
Reviews.Content: Above all, we loved the location of this hotel which is what we booked it for in the first place. It was also spotlessly clean which is obviously very important. However, unfortunately that is where the positives end. Despite phoning a week beforehand to ask if we could get into out room a few hours before the usual check-in and was told they would try their best to accomodate. We were slightly annoyed when we turned up at 12 noon to discover our room not ready but understood. We informed the staff member at the desk that we probably wouldnt be back until late evening but would try to come back to check-in in order to make sure our bags were safe etc. (oh and that same member of staff seemed offened I dare suggest our bags wouldnt be safe in the communal lobby, ridiculous!) So, we found some time to nip back after 2pm which is the stated check-in time only to find the staff member has told the cleaner 'not to bother' preparing our room because we said we wouldn't be back until later. This was made out to be our fault. The room should have been ready for 2pm no matter what in our opinion not left until later so the cleaners could take thier time! We had a busy day and would have appreciated the opportunity to shower. In the staff member's defense, we were offered the dining space downstairs to change and use he bathroom which we took but obviously a room would have been better! On to the room. Yes, it was small but we has prepared ourselves for this so it was fine and as I have mentioned it was very clean. However, we ended up with the only room on the ground floor (Room 1) which we next to reception and under the stairs! We could hear absolutely everyone and everything coming and going on the staircase. It bothered us the first night but after that we were just to exhausted and tired to care so just got on with it. Agan, on the first night, another staff member was constantly yapping on their phone and had a loud rigtone which kept going off. We had to go out to the lobby in out PJs so ask them to stop talking. After trying to make excuses about the hotel phone ringing, their personal mobile rang in their hand with the same annoying ringtone so the conversation was pretty much over and there was no more disturbance. We agree with other reviewers that if you stay, don't bother the the breakfast. Just head out to a little cafe on Monmouth Street or round about and get yourself a decent breakfast. Overall this is an excellent location an if we had a little more money to splash around we would have stayed in the same area but in a different hotel. We probably won't be back here because of our bad experience but I would recommend it if not only for cleanliness and location but dont expect luxury! We really wanted this to be the hidden gem we has been looking for in London, but unfortunately we will have to keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Carol from Midwest
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Seven Dials Hotel. I wanted a pleasant, very reasonably priced hotel close to Covent Garden, Leicester Square and the British Museum. Given how expensive London is, and this neighborhood in particular, I didnâ€™t know if it would be possible to find such a place but fortunately, this is it. The rooms are plain and small, but they are pleasant and clean and the bathrooms seem to be recently updated. I requested a quiet room and was very pleased that I was able to sleep without interruption (I can be sensitive to noise). The staff was friendly. I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location compensate for small size and limited equipment”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: The location right in West End is great and the street is quite. The hotel rooms are however small, somewhat noisy and not really upmarket in terms of furniture and bathroom. Free wifi, but limited connection on the upper two floors, so ask for a first or second floor room (also no elevators). Full English breakfast buffet and friendly and helpfull staff compensate for the rooms. Not a hotel for a long, romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for streetview!”
Reviews.Author: Puslespil
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel couldnÂ´t have been better, great atmosphere right outside the door. The room was small but not the worst IÂ´ve seen in London. BUT! when booking ask for a room facing the street. Our only window opened to a brick wall 3 feet away which meant no air circulation, no daylight what so ever but also a nice peek at the offices located in the building behind the hotel :D The staff was friendly but needed some convincing to fix a clogged drain. Breakfast not impressive, go down the street instead at the local breakfast place for excellent toast and eggs. That said, the place was clean! the area was bursting with life and you felt safe though located in central area of town.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a night or two!”
Reviews.Author: angleseymember
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Mountbatten in Monmouth Street, was looking to stay in that area as was going to see Jersey boys nearby. After reading not so good reviews on that hotel on tripadvisor now, I came accross Seven Dials. After reading the reviews, and knowing what to expect, I decided would be okay for one night. The main reason was the cost, which was Â£115 for twin room with breakfast (cheapest price for the Mountbatten was Â£185 therefore no brainer!). No point in me repeating what everyone else here have said about about steep steps, small bathroom etc etc (which is all true!). Main reasons I would say for you to stay here is cleanliness and superb location for theatreland, Covent Garden, walking distance to Buckingham Palace, London Eye etc. Breakfast was very basic with only orange juice, one choice of cereal and 'full English' which could only be described as mediocre. If you want luxury then you will definitely have to look elsewhere, but for value, friendly staff and great location, then I would recommend and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and friendly - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DoncasterWoodman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their triple room with my two daughters. Stairs a little steep and en suite very, very small but this hotel is perfectly located a short stroll from the theatres. Staff very friendly and helpful. Not luxurious but this reflected in the excellent price. Room very clean. Would certainly use again for a couple of nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but does the job!”
Reviews.Author: CheshireRocketman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during November. After reading all of the reviews on here before i had booked the hotel i knew it was going to be quite a small room i would be in. The room size wasn't a problem at all though as it was only used as a shower & a bed so space wasn't really a neccessity. The hotel is in a brilliant location everything is within easy reach , albeit on foot or tube! The staff were a bit hit & miss - some were really pleasant some really miserable! The place was very clean also. The only problem i had with the hotel is the standard of food at breakfast, i only ate there one day as the food on offer wasn't really up to much......there was no fruit only 1 type of cereal (which had seen better days) & the cooked option looked as though it had been on display all week. I have stayed in worse places but i wouldn't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small and good hotel in the greatest area of London”
Reviews.Author: Sophietje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room Â°18 during 2 nights last week. It was a very small room on the top floor and you had to take a lot of steps to get upstairs. In the room you have a bed for 2, a desk with mirror and tv, a hairdryer, a built-in cupboard and a bathroom with toilet, sink and shower... It is a small hotel and a small room but the rooms where clean, the breakfast was not bad at all and the hotel is located near Covent Garden and that's a plus! I surely would recommend this hotel to everybody who's going to do some sightseeing and who likes to stay in the greatest neighbourghood of London!

Reviews.Title: “Not for hamster swingers!”
Reviews.Author: Movvi
Reviews.Content: Very basic but great value in terms of location - right in the heart of Covent Garden. Clean with friendly staff and a good breakfast, this hotel offered all we needed for a short break in London. There was absolutely no noise from other rooms or from outside. Shops, bars, restaurants, Underground stations and theatres are all in walking distance from the Seven Dials. Room was tiny - not enough space to swing a hamster though we did make an amusing video of ourselves traversing the room, squeezing past the bed along the walls, etc. We had a great time regardless!

Reviews.Title: “Prison Cellish”
Reviews.Author: mondo12
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights here at The Seven Dials Hotel, One thing which we cannot complain about is the location, this hotel is in a lovely part of london,only a stones throw from covent garden and is surrounded by plenty of cool bars,cafes and shops. Our issue with the place was the room size, it was tiny,I mean really tiny, if one of us wanted to get changed the other would have to get into the bed because there was not enough floor space for the two of us to stand, and we are small people, god help some of the larger guests! You couldnt swing a fly in here,never mind a cat. On arrival we phoned reception and asked for a larger room but we were told are room was standard. On the second day we were on the way to our room and we noticed room no.1 tucked in under the stairs which made us kind of appreciate what we had,the place was like a large dog kennel. We had breakfast on 1 of our 3 nights and it was enough, it was like warm Fisher Price food. I know it is difficult to find good value in a good location in London but I think it should be clearly stated on the hotel web site,"Not suitable for claustrophobics".

Reviews.Title: “ideal for sightseerers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: missymel
Reviews.Content: we (a couple) stayed for 1 night on the 3rd floor. As we were only stopping for 2days the room really did serve its purposes for somehwere to sleep. The rooms were clean and adeqaute althought the room was really small. A small t.v with only 5 channels to choose from and tea/coffe making facilities. towels are soaps are provided. We paid a toTal of Â£95.00 including a full english breakfast (buffet style) sausages were very small n cheap but above all it still filled us up for the day. The staff are very efficient, friendly and helpful. If u are on a budget and u dont intend on staying in the hotel then this is a good place to go. Its bang in the middle of covent garden. literally 2 mins walk from the theater distirct and 5 mins from china town and soho. You dont even need to get the tube to these places. We walked to china town for a meal and went on to soho til the early hours and got a rikshaw cab (men on bikes) back to the hotel which only cost Â£5.00. All in all a great place to stay in terms of location. but if your looking for romance or a something a bit more special then i would recommend elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “great location....... nothing else though!”
Reviews.Author: peterpanHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: if you intend to book this hotel forget spacious, roomy, comfort and quiet . We stayed on the ground floor (to avoid walking up a narrow steep staircase-no lifts!) Unfortunately we were next to reception..during the night we heard every fax that arrived!!! The double bed was a three quarter bed pushed against a wall...no room for stretching..my wife was pinned against the wall all night..I cannot under-exaggerate the crampness of the room. We ate breakfast at 9ish...buffet style english..it was not fresh..looked like been out for hours.. Having said all that location was great for all we wanted to do...next time would pay more for better class hotel.There is a modern travelodge around the corner for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “It's the location and the staff that makes the hotel”
Reviews.Author: d2deb
Reviews.Content: The Owner is extremely personable and helpful. Everyone who works here is pleasant and friendly. Everything is clean and everything worked. I read the other reviews and agree the rooms are small with spartan furnishing and noisy, if facing the street. Now the trade off..... If you can easily afford to pay 160euro a night for the hotel across the street then go for it. It is a nicer hotel. But if you hate to toss away that amount of money in a room you'll probably spend 8 hours a day in; then the Seven Dial is the best bet in the area. It is all a balance of cost and location to me. You can get cheaper hotels out around Hyde Park but I have no interest in spending all my time on the tube. I've made that mistake and regretted it - a waste of my time in London. I want to stay in the Theater/Museum area of Covent Gardens. I've stayed at many hotels in this area and I think the Seven Dials is top of the list in that price range. You can easily find nicer hotels but you'll pay at a minimum double the price. Again if money is no issue then go somewhere else. You can't beat the location here. I want a hotel I can stop by to change clothes or pick up something from my room, in between a Museum and Lunch without taking what turns out to be an hour tube ride out to another part of the city. It is less than 5 min to the British Museum, within 10 min to Leister Square, dozens of theaters or the National Gallery. There are great restaurants in the immediate area (Punjabi around the corner is fantastic). Some of the items people have complained about for this hotel are just common facts of this class/price range hotels in London: the steep narrow stairway, the small rooms, minuscule en suite bathroom, the cheesy furnishings, cramped breakfast room- you will find these exact same qualities in most hotels of this 'class'. However, the difference here, we found everything to be very clean, the staff very friendly and everything serviceable - that is not always the case with the other hotels in this class. This is why I would rate the Severn Dials as best bet in the area. There is no elevator - if you cannot CARRY your suitcase (not pull it but actually lift it) then you might find the stairs a problem (however on arrival the owner happy offered to bring my suitcase up to the room). Do bring earplugs if road noise bothers you. I was there in winter, in summer with the windows open it will be noisy. If you are coming in/out of Heathrow with minimal luggage just jump on the tube and get off at Covent Gardens very easy no changes and direct - it takes about 45 mins. If you take the Heathrow express from Paddington you have to change a couple times, which lengthens that 15 min express train to also 45 mins. If you have too much luggage catch a taxi. For the Eurostar it is 15 min/7Â£ taxi ride or again the Piccadilly line to Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not enough”
Reviews.Author: Expats-in-Wien
Reviews.Content: We booked the Seven Dials for a family holiday with our teen-age daughters and planned to stay for 5 nights. Upon arrival we wondered if we had gone just too low in our search for a good deal in London! The location as everyone notes, was ideal, so we checked in. The front desk person handed us a key and pointed to the very narrow stairs. This was the lightest moment of our stay as 4 adults attempted to carry normal-sized suitcases up a very narrow and curving staircase. Up and up and up until we finally got to our door. Once inside the door, it was not clear where we could put the suitcase down. To get into the bathroom, we had to pull the thin door into the bed area and then step around the sink to pull the door closed. A can on the floor was lined with an plastic bag from a grocery store. The closet had 5 mis-match and partly broken hangers from the dry cleaner and on the floor of this "closet" was a crumpled up bedspread of some kind which I believe was our spare blanket. The shades on the bedside lamps were shredded. Trying to put on a good face and knowing we had full plans for our stay--restaurants and theatre etc. I assured my husband we could deal with it. He did not sleep well and the next morning he had us all pack up and we checked out. The front desk clerk was shocked and said we couldn't just leave and so he told me I had to pay for one more night and even at that he sighed and shook his head and clearly disapproved. I told him our plans had changed. We walked across the street and checked into the <much more expensive> but extremely nice Radisson Edwardian Mountbatten Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny rooms..............”
Reviews.Author: Witchywoman007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel and wanted to share our experiences. The hotel is located two blocks from the Covent Garden tube station, (Picadilly Line) and about a 10" walk from the Strand. The hotel is also conveniently located to a number of theatres, close to Covent Garden, many fabulous restaurants and pubs and some great stores. The hotel and room were fairly clean. There is no lift and the stairway leading to the rooms is very, very narrow. The front door is always locked but there is a someone on duty 24 hours to let you in. Breakfast consisted of juice, instant coffee, corn flakes, fried and scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, beans and stewed tomatoes. Toast and corn flakes were also available. The breakfast is served in the basement dining room from 7:00 - 9:00 and is buffet style. The owner was friendly and helpful. The room was so tiny there was only space for a double bed, night table, closet and chair. One suitcase got the chair while the other one had to stay on the floor beside the bed. The bed linen was clean but did not get changed during our stay. There is a small TV suspended from the wall, (3 channels only) but no clock, (take your own alarm clock). The bathroom was clean but as the shower was very slow to drain, we ended up standing in about 3" of water once the shower was done. The water was very hot, pressure was OK and towels were thick. The hotel worked for us as we left early in the day and only returned to sleep. If you're looking for inexpensive in the heart of London, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seven Dials”
Reviews.Author: NimetEgypt
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a week trip in London. We stayed in a triple room at the Seven Dials Hotel. The location is perfect, the room is spotless clean and it's size is OK. The owner and his staff are extremely helpful. We would definitely go back in our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Phil816
Reviews.Content: As the title of my review suggests, the location of this hotel is it's main selling point. It is right in the heart of the West End and a short walk from Piccadilly Circus and other main attractions. I defy anyone to find another hotel offering bed and breakfast for two people for Â£85 per night in anywhere near as good a location. The hotel was clean and the staff were all friendly, although the one time we needed directions the Polish woman on the desk had only been working there for a couple of days and couldn't help us - not her fault I suppose! Breakfast was buffet style and consisted of a full English breakfast, but with not a great deal of choice. However, it was more than adequate for us. The room was an en-suite but was very tiny and the stairs to the rooms are extremely narrow. The rooms are so small I would not recommend anyone to stay there for more than a few days unless you like living out of a suitcase - there is very little space anywhere to store your clothes! I would be happy to stay there again (for short periods), however it was my girlfriends first ever trip to the UK and she refuses to let me book this hotel again for a planned trip to London in December. I've tried explaining the plus points in respect of price and location, but she wants somewhere with enough room to be be able to sit other than on the bed and where you have enough space to hand your clothes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in hip part of London, near amazing food and the West End”
Reviews.Author: Shanna S
Reviews.Content: Found the Seven Dials via booking.com, after a long search for a great location at a good price. Seven Dials is right in a very hip part of London, within 2 blocks of West End theatres. There are a lot of great clothing, cosmetic, and book stores nearby. The room is small, but we've stayed in smaller! The bathrub/shower was a nice surprise, it was roomy and comfortable. The room had no view, so we kept the window closed the whole time. There is a ceiling fan, but it goes off when the lights go off. That was a bit unfortunate as the room got warm in the night. Also - BRING YOUR OWN ALARM CLOCK! Or, most of us have cell phones we can use. But if you necessitate a clock, bring one. The front desk is happy to wake you with a phone call also. The most amazing Indian food I've ever had is about 20 steps away at Punjabi. Across the street directly is a lovely Italian cafe with cheap wine and good pasta. If you're flying from Heathrow: don't bother with the expensive Express Train or a mess of tube stops. Ask the desk to book you an express taxi. It was 25 pounds for the two of us and 4 pieces of luggage, dropped us RIGHT at the terminal entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: napoli1926
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic and beats any deficiencies that it might have. We had only a 5 minutes walk from Leicester Square and Piccadilly Circus. Transport is also very close with bus stops and 2 underground stations (Covent Garden and Leicester Square) close by. We booked a room with en suite bath and shower and was very tidy - although small and the furniture might need some renovation. Breakfast was also served every morning with punctuality although there was no variation on the menu. Considering the price of other hotels nearby, this hotel is value for money, even though in my country, Malta, for this price (GBP 85 per night) you can book a room in a 4 or 5 stal hotel which are internationally acclaimed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: nellycorn
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about my trip to London, more so about this hotel because I had read so many mixed reviews on this site and others. I was even tempted to cancel my reservation and book another hotel. I am so pleased I did not cancel as I could not be happier about my stay here. We arrived around midday and although we couldn't check in until after 2pm because the room had to be cleaned after the previous guests, we were allowed to leave our case in the secure reception area (the main door has a secure entry system) to allow us to go a wee wander. When we got back to the hotel, I realised the comments about the staircase were true as I struggled to get my huge suitcase up the narrow stairs, however with smaller cases/bags, this should not pose as a problem. We stayed on the 2nd floor, room 6. This room had a double bed and a single bed, a wardrobe with hangers, a desk with mirror and stool, plenty of drawer units, tv (although reception wasn't great but I wasn't there to watch tv so didn't bother too much about this), coffee/tea making facilities, toilet, shower and wash hand basin. Everything you could need really. The room was very clean and I could not fault it at all. My only comment would be that there perhaps were not enough accessible sockets for girls who blow dry and straighten their hair, at the same time as charging their mobiles like me. Also the socket behind the tv unit was slightly loose but worked fine. The staff were extremely friendly and had no problems letting us in the main door every time my mum wanted to go out for a cigarette. Talking of which, I previously read a comment about the street not being safe at night well I have to disagree. We never felt unsafe about anyone passing us on Monmouth street. Also, our room looked onto the street and there really wasn't a lot of street noise through the night for London. The location of this hotel was ideal. I had never been to London before and found my way around just fine mainly because all the main areas surrounded the hotel. Oxford Street was a short walk, several underground stations were also a short walk, many theatres are just around the corner. Both mornings we were served a lovely buffet breakfast. Three kinds of egg, bacon, sausage, tomato, beans, toast, cereal, coffee, tea and orange juice. The eating area was in the basement and was very clean with excellent service. Finally, when we checked out, the gentleman told us if we want to stay again we should book direct with the hotel because it is cheaper than going through a website. We checked out early (latest 11am) but were allowed to leave our bags and collect them later. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Duck-Rabbit
Reviews.Content: The Seven Dials was in a great location! It's conveniently located by both Covent Garden and Leciester Square Tube stops on a simply charming street in Covent Garden. We were worried about the size of the room, but the double room we stayed in was plenty spacious. While walking up some winding stairs with suitcases can be a hassel, you really cannot find a hotel in London in this price range that has an elevator. Seriously, I challenge you to find one! The staff were also accommodating and the english breakfast was a great way to start the day. One recommendation: bring a travel alarm clock! We'll definitely be back for future travels to London!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous”
Reviews.Author: SallyEvans
Reviews.Content: The location should not be taken into account as the area is not safe at night. I was told I had to stand outside the hotel to have a cigarette and was then approached by a dubious man who wanted to,'chat.' As you are always buzzed into the hotel it was completely unsafe! You should get a taxi from a nice hotel and use the underground in the day. The shower didn't work and was not given an alternative without further payment. No adjustment was made in the bill even though hadn't had a shower in 2 days, just barrage of excuses. Stairs rediculously narrow. Blankets were badly stained and there really is not a square inch of space where the owner has not put another room to make more money. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small but well located”
Reviews.Author: superduper
Reviews.Content: I can't on the basis of comfort and value for money bring myself to give this hotel any higher than 3 stars. The location is 10 minutes from Pic. Circus so location is perfect. Thats why it got the three stars! The rest is ..well... basic. Room is very small. Think, tripping over end of bed, nowhere to put luggage and furniture that can be moved with baby finger. Not exactly quality. Toilet is cubby hole. ...back to door whilst at sink. Nowhere for toilet roll to go apart from on floor, shelf 2 inches X 12 inches on which to place all your toileteries. Its a bit tedious after a while. The stairs is 2 feet wide and goes around in a spiral so its hard to walk down. Its an old house in London so its just the way it is. Its not really the owners/managers fault. However the price for London accommodation is just appauling in general. This place is rubbish value for money as is the whole of London. The breakfast is ok and is buffet style. I preferred this. On second day the beans and egg were cold. Two surly girls (looks like family run place) are in charge of breakfast. Other staff were fine particularly the lady of reception (looks like wife -you get picture?). I'm guessing Dad answers door when you ring doorbell. Its a small place for sure with low quality and a high price. Thank God the location is ok. Would I go back? Yes. I would be afraid the next hotel in London would be even worse..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect for the theatre!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleA1985
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 friends (ladies aged 21-32) stayed at this hotel last weekend (Jan 5th) for 1 night as we were seeing Grease in Piccadilly Theatre. We booked a triple room which was 1 single bed and 1 double bed. We had a tv, hairdryer, fan, kettle with tea and coffee. It says you cant check in until 2pm but we arrived about 11.30am and were able to go straight up to the room. We were on the second floor in room number 2. The stair case is very narrow and steep, so i would be careful with larger suitcase as there is no life. The staff were lovely. They were very helpful and advised the best places to eat and drink and the older man had no problem us buzzing the door to be let in at 3.30am after a rather heavy cocktail drinking session! We were in quite a poor state i can tell you! We also ended up in a gay bar but we only realised when we were in. Apparently the area is well known for the gay bars. We had a great experience. The location is fab! We got quite lost when we walked out of leicester square station but once you know where to go you will have no troule finding your way. Breakfast was 8am to 10am, after a rather heavy drinking session we needed food! We arrived at the last minute at 9.45am and there was still a full english left in the buffet, with toast, tea, coffee. A lovely girl took our orderes of tea, coffee and toast and didnt complain that we had turned up just before closing. We checked out at 11am and made our way home with pouding headaches - but it was our own faults and it was my birthday!! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, out 1 night stay was exactly what we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bighar
Reviews.Content: The Seven Dials is in a fantastic area. The hotel is quaint but it has it's drawbacks. It has an extremely narrow staircase and it has no elevator. Be aware that if you are on the third or fourth floor it is a challenge to get luggage to your room. The rooms are tiny, and there is a good chance that if you are traveling as a couple that you will not sleep in the same bed. However the location is fantasitc. The area is lively with many great pubs within a block. Right in the middle of all of the best shows, so the opportunities for entertainment are endless. The Seven Dials is a great place to use as a home base. They offer a very good breakfast in the morning for its guests, but you have to brave a steep flight of slippery steps to get to it. There is a fabulous pub called "Freuvd" located just to the right at subterrainean level that is worth checking out. Many great dining opportunites around the area. We would stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Furcyte
Reviews.Content: Just returned from weekend stay 11-14 October in Seven Dials Hotel. Mixed feelings... Room No17 - in 4th floor: very very small, walls were dirty, wardrobe rocked every time we opened its door (we thought - it might crumble at any time!..), shower has no power (I could not wash my head) and was broken...After 2 nights we moved to second floor room - it looked better, but...we could not sleep with opened window - terrible smell of roasted onions from restaurant starting from early morning until midnight!..Half of last night we were constantly disturbed by drunk prostitute, who visited guest in neighbouring room - every time she walked outside the room to find the WC, she mussed up the rooms and tried to get in to our room...That's the sad side... Good: acceptable breakfast, pleasant staff, VERY GOOD LOCATION - I think that's made our stay more or less acceptable. Would I stay here again? Probably not... I'll choose cheap Arran House Hotel in Gower Street (also good location in Bloomsbury area) - the same price, but the hotel is very much different - much better.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucreciamott
Reviews.Content: I thought all budget hotels in London were shabby and terrible, but after the Seven Dials I have changed my mind. Not only is its location wonderful (five minutes walking from Covent Garden) but the place is CLEAN and rooms are ENSUITE. And the place is also CHEAP! Me and my two girlfriends were surprised and delighted. Our fare included english breakfast too and the staff were so helpful we were most of the time waiting for the candid camera to appear! Really, I've stayed in budget hotels in London many times and this is a jewel. The only problem, VERY steep stairs. And that's all! (for this budget, of course). I hope owners and guests contribute to keeping this place nice and clean, because I will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Zampo
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend are just come back home (in Rome) after our stay in London. We stayed at the Seven Dials Hotel 4 nights...it was simply amazing! There are at least three optimal reasons to enjoy this hotel. FIRST: the location...the seven dials area is one of the most "glamour", lovely and lively in all London...it's just few steps from Covent Garden Tube Station...from Thottenam Court Tube Station... from Oxford Street, Soho, Trafalgar Sq., and so on... SECOND: the staff, absolutelly kindly, helpful, professional...and the breakfast is as good as at home! THIRD: the value! Are you able to find something similar in that area for less? It's a good three stars service and room but a cheap b&b price! They have 4 floor with few rooms, but they haven't lift, so if you have problems with the stairs, ask for a 1st floor room...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, but a bit on the small side”
Reviews.Author: lildebbie77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights with my husband and stepson, sharing a triple room. The room is on the small side and the bathroom is tiny - but pretty much the only thing we did in our room was sleep and talk, so we didn't need a great deal of space. We took advantage of the wardrobe to unpack a couple of our suitcases so that we wouldn't have to open them all the time, and that probably made a huge difference in space issues. The staircase IS tiny, so if you have to drag luggage up, then make sure you can handle it. :) I cannot say enough how wonderful this location is! We were able to walk so many places , and I could shop to my heart's content without having to worry about dragging lots of bags on the Tube during busy hours. The breakfast was a little monotonous after 6 mornings of eggs, bacon and sausage - but it was prepared with a smile every morning. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our toilet our last day there, and the owner quickly fixed, very cheerfuly. I will definitely stay here again if I ever return to London.

Reviews.Title: “GoodLocation,”
Reviews.Author: LauraCork-2006
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Seven Dials and our hearts dropped! Outside looked dull, dusty and old. "Oh dear" we thought what have we let ourselves in for, We arrived too early for check in, so we left our bags in the "reception" which is a tiny hall and our bags were right beside the doorway, which left us uneasy till we returned. On returning at 2pm for check-in we were told our room wasn't ready which was annoying as we had been up since 5am! Eventually we were allowed to our room which was on the 3rd floor. The stairs is hardly wide enough for one person, never mind one person and a big suitcase and hand luggage and hand bags and NO LIFT. It took us much pushing, straining, stopping, heaving, falling over and giggling to get to the 3rd floor. I would not recommend to anyone who hasn't tried out for the olympics recently. Our room wasn't as dreadful as we expected after seeing the rest of the "hotel", The room was small but we made do, in fact it wasn't as small as other London hotels we've been in. The bathroom was TINY though. Plenty of towels and toilet paper and soap (not wrapped). Bedclothes were clean and room seemed generally clean, We had a view onto the street outside which we were happy with initially till we realised that it would and did keep us awake at night. Every sound could be heard from other rooms so if you are partaking in any nightly activities, don't forget your neighbours ;) We had a look at the breakfast room and decided we were not going near it again. Its tiny, old, cramped, ewww! Staff were very friendly, all foreigners but with good english. Location of this "hotel" was superb. We were going to a few Shows so it was ideal and we were going to Leicester Square for clubbing which was a ten minute walk. Our television broke on Saturday afternoon and we were afraid we would miss The X-Factor so the manager of the hotel came as fast as he could with a new television so that we wouldnt miss our show. We were very grateful. The rooms were quite cold and very dark all the time too. Also we noticed that anyone could get into this hotel. We did ring the bell but they never questioned us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget hotel for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: Audiomaven
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel in an excellent location for sightseeing, this is the hotel for you. If you are looking for lots of ammenities, stay across the street at the expensive Radisson. Seven Dials is only a few blocks to the nearest tube and bus stops (Tottenham Court Road) and close to nightlife. Central Covent Garden and Soho are within walking distance. Covent Garden starts a few doors down with Neal's Yard, funky hip shopping and restaurants. We had asked for a quiet room in the back and even got a triple room instead of a double. It was much bigger than we were expecting. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We were suprised by the large breakfast offered. FYI - The hotel does not have a lift and has four floors with a narrow stairway. If this is an issue, request a first floor room. Also every now and then you can hear the rooms around you, but it's not a big deal. Yes this is a basic hotel. You don't get little bottles of shampoo you don't use. However the only other hotels I found in this price range (NOT including breakfast) with good reviews were in King's Cross where people were afraid to walk down the street at night. I was very happy to stumble across this gem. Also it was much cleaner than some hotels I've stayed at in the U.S. The other reviews here are spot on. The couple who hated it in October (KKincaid) obviously didn't read the reviews before booking the hotel. I booked through[--] We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's where it stops”
Reviews.Author: KKincaid
Reviews.Content: I can recommend the Seven Dials/Covent Garden area as a wonderful place to stay ...but don't stay at the Seven Dials Hotel. On the plus side, the area is a Sci-Fi fan mecca --Forbidden Planet is right across the boulevard and other similarly-themed stores are nearby. There's also a terrific little restaurant called Cafe Pasta directly adjacent to the Seven Dials entrance. Unfortunately, that's where the good points end. An optimist might describe this hotel as "cozy, quirky and unpretentious," all of which would be accurate but not in a good way. Our room was tiny and plain to an extreme, and was lacking nearly all amenities save hot water and a TV. The (admittedly friendly and helpful) staff fetch supplies by climbing through a window on a stairway landing onto what seems to be an adjacent rooftop, and one addresses the (again friendly) front desk clerk by calling through a darkened sort of ticket-booth room towards the room where the clerk actually sits. Once we were in the room (note: carrying suitcase up the narrow, bendy staircase is challenging to a dramatic degree), we couldn't put the suitcases anywhere that did not block the room door, the bathroom door, or the bed. Our stay convinced us to be willing to spend a little more next time we're in London, and we're just grateful that it wasn't for more than one night, especially since neither of us could sleep in the room's uncomfortable double bed. This was NOT a good value for the 80 pounds it cost us to stay here... unless you're all about Location Location Location...

Reviews.Title: “Great location by N. Irish couple”
Reviews.Author: mkellyni
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Seven Dials, Â£80 per night for a double room ensuite with breakfast. My husband and i wanted somewhere to stay that was central to all the attractions as we were wary of using the tube and knew black taxis in London are very expensive. We weren't dissapointed, this hotel is five mins walk from Covent Gardens, Soho and for those who love sight seeing you are able to walk to Buckingham Palace, The Thames, Westminster Abbey, St James Park in 10-15mins. This hotel is in the heart of theatre land and there are lots of nice cafes at hand. We enjoyed a great meal at Maxwells American restaurant were we got 2 for 1 on our main courses using the discount card in a covent garden leaflet we picked up free! This card offered many discounts including shopping and bars. The Seven Dials is very cheap for its location, the room was small but clean, the breakfast was freshly made buffet style and the staff were really lovely. What more would you need. Who says London has to be expensive?!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pugtrump
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between Covent Garden and Oxford St. Triple room for Â£110 a night including decent breakfast. Clean basic room with everything one needs for a clean, basic stay. Only problem is the noise, which is traffic, people having fun, workmen, binmen , etc etc etc! Staff friendly and very welcoming, no lift so not for the less mobile visitor but very good overall value, take your earplugs!

HotelInfo.Name: Seven Dials Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Monmouth Street, London WC2H 9DA, England
